activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#5552
activity.text:
> ```shell
> git checkout <other-pr-branch-name> # "develop"
> git merge <this-pr-branch-name> # "NoticeBoard"
> git push
> ```
> 
> Also, make sure the files have been changed correctly and that there is no more material ui usage on the entire file. After that, you should update your main comment on that PR to link issues related to this PR too.

Can I add a comment in the Illustrations issue ,that this issue is a duplicate of the current issue to link them ?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#5552
activity.text:
> 1. You've moved the line of import of MUI components. This might go undetected without a merge conflict when both your PRs are merged. Feel free to push changes directly to your other PR and link both issues there. This is much easier.
> 2. Why are there diffs in other files? Kindly configure your git to use proper line endings (LF).
> 
> ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25143503/241557826-e5101a15-3966-4a48-b97f-fc443bf0de0d.png)

can you tell me how do I merge two two issues ?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#5544
activity.text:
> You are introducing so many packages and also new material UI packages into the codebase. However, we are trying to get rid of material UI libraries entirely.
> 
> Try to achieve the same without using any new packages and use tailwind only.
> 
> Also, link issues to your PRs so that it's easier to track. Refer: https://docs.github.com/en/issues/tracking-your-work-with-issues/linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue#linking-a-pull-request-to-an-issue-using-a-keyword

alright I thought since material ui is already being used ,why not use it ,i will try to make a custom component with tailwind css
and about the packages I thought they would be helpful for a few features but didnt use them.
